-- =============================================================================
-- OpenHack MDWH
-- Azure Synapse Analytics Demo
-- https://github.com/aessing/demo-azuresynapse
-- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Developer.......: Andre Essing (https://www.andre-essing.de/)
--                                (https://github.com/aessing)
--                                (https://twitter.com/aessing)
--                                (https://www.linkedin.com/in/aessing/)

-- THIS CODE AND INFORMATION ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,
-- EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED
-- WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND/OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
-- =============================================================================

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[MoveData]
	@DateToMove DATE,
	@SwitchIn BIT = 1
AS
	-- Declare local variables...
	DECLARE
		@PartitionNumber integer;

	-- Get the Partition Number...
	SELECT @PartitionNumber = boundary_id
	FROM sys.partition_range_values
	WHERE [value] = @DateToMove;

	-- Determine if we are moving data in or out...
	IF (@SwitchIn = 1)
	BEGIN
		-- Switch the Customer data...
		ALTER TABLE Hidden.Customers SWITCH PARTITION @PartitionNumber TO dbo.Customers PARTITION @PartitionNumber;

		-- Switch the Address data...
		ALTER TABLE Hidden.Addresses SWITCH PARTITION @PartitionNumber TO dbo.Addresses PARTITION @PartitionNumber;

		-- Switch the Transaction data...
		ALTER TABLE Hidden.Transactions SWITCH PARTITION @PartitionNumber TO dbo.Transactions PARTITION @PartitionNumber;

		-- Apply updates to the Customer records...
		UPDATE dbo.Customers
		SET
			LastName = U.LastName,
			FirstName = U.FirstName,
			PhoneNumber = U.PhoneNumber,
			UpdatedDate = U.UpdatedDate
		FROM dbo.Customers C
		INNER JOIN Hidden.CustomerUpdates U
			ON (U.CustomerID = C.CustomerID)
		WHERE U.UpdatedDate = @DateToMove;

		-- Apply updates to the Address records...
		UPDATE dbo.Addresses
		SET
			AddressLine1 = U.AddressLine1,
			AddressLine2 = U.AddressLine2,
			City = U.City,
			State = U.State,
			ZipCode = U.ZipCode,
			UpdatedDate = U.UpdatedDate
		FROM dbo.Addresses C
		INNER JOIN Hidden.AddressUpdates U
			ON (U.AddressID = C.AddressID)
		WHERE U.UpdatedDate = @DateToMove;

		-- Apply updates to the Transaction records...
		UPDATE dbo.Transactions
		SET
			StreamEnd = U.StreamEnd,
			UpdatedDate = U.UpdatedDate
		FROM dbo.Transactions C
		INNER JOIN Hidden.TransactionUpdates U
			ON (U.TransactionID = C.TransactionID)
		WHERE U.UpdatedDate = @DateToMove;
	END
	ELSE
	BEGIN
		-- Switch the Customer data...
		ALTER TABLE dbo.Customers SWITCH PARTITION @PartitionNumber TO Hidden.Customers PARTITION @PartitionNumber;

		-- Switch the Address data...
		ALTER TABLE dbo.Addresses SWITCH PARTITION @PartitionNumber TO Hidden.Addresses PARTITION @PartitionNumber;

		-- Switch the Transaction data...
		ALTER TABLE dbo.Transactions SWITCH PARTITION @PartitionNumber TO Hidden.Transactions PARTITION @PartitionNumber;

		-- Apply updates to the Orders records...
		UPDATE dbo.Transactions
		SET
			StreamEnd = NULL,
			UpdatedDate = CreatedDate
		WHERE TransactionID IN
		(
			SELECT TransactionID
			FROM Hidden.TransactionUpdates
			WHERE UpdatedDate = @DateToMove
		);
	END
